ARABIC: وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Be steadfast in the face of what they say and cut yourself off from them - but courteously.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Bear with patience what they say, and gracefully come away from them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And bear patiently the vain things they utter, and gracefully forsake them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Bear patiently whatever they say, do not yield to them and keep on preaching decently to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And patiently endure upon what the disbelievers say, and leave them for good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And be patient with what they say, and keep away from them in a good way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And bear patiently what they say and avoid them with a becoming avoidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And bear thou patiently what they say, and forsake them graciously.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And bear with patience what they utter, and part from them with a fair leave-taking.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Bear patiently with what they say, and ignore them politely.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And bear thou with patience whatsoever they say, and depart from them with a becoming departure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and be patient over what they say, and distance yourself from them in a graceful manner.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And have patience with what they say, and leave them with noble (dignity).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And be patient (O Muhammad SAW) with what they say, and keep away from them in a good way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Bear patiently with what they say and with a fine abandonment forsake them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And endure patiently what they say, and withdraw from them politely.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [73:10] and bear patiently what they say, that is, the disbelievers of Mecca, in the way of their maltreatment [of you], and part with them in a gracious manner, without any anguish — this was [revealed] before the command to fight them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And bear with patience) Muhammad (what they utter) of vilification and denial, (and part from them with a fair leave-taking) steer clear of them in a fair way, neither grieving nor reciprocating with indecency.
